# The `IRLinker` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This is responsible for keeping track of the state used for moving data from SrcM to DstM. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

This is responsible for keeping track of the state used for moving data from SrcM to DstM.

Definition at line 378 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/linker/irmover-cpp">IRMover.cpp</a>.

## Private Member Functions

### computeTypeMapping() {#a1bb1842b61678d0195c91ba8c9b9b860}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void IRLinker::computeTypeMapping ()">
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> over all of the linked values to compute type mappings.

For example, if we link &quot;extern Foo &#42;x&quot; and &quot;Foo &#42;x = NULL&quot;, then we have two struct types &#39;Foo&#39; but one got renamed when the module was loaded into the same <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext">LLVMContext</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/linker/irmover-cpp/#l00474">474</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/linker/irmover-cpp">IRMover.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> through the global variables in the src module and merge them into the dest module.

### flushRAUWWorklist() {#a21ce64a4fa65de75859ba8fcbbabe321}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void IRLinker::flushRAUWWorklist ()">
Perform &quot;replace all uses with&quot; operations.

These work items need to be performed as part of materialization, but we postpone them to happen after materialization is done. The materializer called by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuemapper">ValueMapper</a> is not expected to delete constants, as <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuemapper">ValueMapper</a> is holding pointers to some of them, but constant destruction may be indirectly triggered by RAUW. Hence, the need to move this out of the materialization call chain.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/linker/irmover-cpp/#l00512">512</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/linker/irmover-cpp">IRMover.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["inline"]}>

### IsPerformingImport {#a2e7a307acf9c8d5d48f47fadad69939d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;IRMover.cpp&#125;::IRLinker::IsPerformingImport</>}>
Whether we are importing globals for ThinLTO, as opposed to linking the source module.

If this flag is set, it means that we can rely on some other object file to define any non-GlobalValue entities defined by the source module. This currently causes us to not link retained types in debug info metadata and module inline asm.

Mapping of values from what they used to be in Src, to what they are now in DstM.

<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abf0f52ae29f87b5e0f2b95ff961cdae1">ValueToValueMapTy</a> is a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuemap">ValueMap</a>, which involves some overhead due to the use of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> handles which the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/linker">Linker</a> doesn&#39;t actually need, but this allows us to reuse the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuemapper">ValueMapper</a> code.
